intro: Erodium oreophilum, commonly known as the mountain bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe and western Asia. It is a low-growing herbaceous plant with slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The flowers are typically pink or purple, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems, and bloom from late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. The plant is noted for its ability to tolerate harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native range.
